column1:
,TRUE,4,3,3,5,4 alfred_the_buttler","2019-04-01T17:00:31.373Z","A surprisingly difficult Juniors set ","

So I got this for my son when he first made the jump from Duplos to Legos. While it is a &ldquo
column3: set, he had no reason at the time to know these were girl colors, and quite honestly, yellow is a perfectly normal house color. But one of our favorite things to build with Duplos were houses and there are surprisingly few Lego sets for little ones that are houses.&nbsp

column1: The set however has one major problem, it is simply too large and too many pieces for a kid at the Juniors level. Not only did this set have the largest piece count of any of his sets at the time, but it contains a single build. Where his Batman Juniors sets had less pieces, they would also contain several separate builds such as a Batcave, a Batmobile, and something else for the bad guy. As a result, he could at least build one or two of the builds within his attention span. But this house, well he couldn&rsquo
column2: t even build the first floor before his attention span would run out. Yes this set uses lots of larger bricks, but it should not be a Juniors set. Today, nearly 2 years later, my now 5 year old son has no problem building this, but he also has no problem building Ninjago or Star Wars sets designed for 8 or 9 year olds.&nbsp

column1: My son does like this set now, it is nice to have a house, but perhaps I should have gotten him a more elaborate Creator set at this point, which also wouldn&rsquo
column2: t have been so girly looking, although I suppose my daughter may appreciate this when she&rsquo
column3: s older. However, I simply can&rsquo
column4: t recommend this set because it&rsquo
column5: s just too difficult for the age range it is designed for, and once your child is old enough to take on a set of this size, they can take on much larger and more complex builds.&nbsp

column1: The set really includes a lot of great parts, especially in terms of minifigure accessories, there are cooking utensils, food, a teddie bear, ball, and a bike - all of which are incredibly useful for play. The rest of the parts are larger including a lot of wall panels as well as three large plates, so as your child&rsquo
column2: s Lego collection grows, these will be very valuable in building houses of their own creation without needing to have tons of bricks. Plus it has plenty of useful furniture pieces, most impressive is the TV.&nbsp

column1: This is why I got the set and it is great. Maybe it isn&rsquo
column2: t as exciting to have a house as it is to have Batman or Star Wars or Ninjago, but it is nice to have as sometimes you will want to play house and it&rsquo
column3: s very nice having a normal family in a normal home. I would have liked one more minifigure, a little boy, so that you would have a brother and sister to play with, but that&rsquo
column4: s easy enough to add on your own. This set is all very useful if you have a firefighter set as you now have a building that can be set on fire.&nbsp

column1: Its actually a nice set, but I&rsquo
column2: m not sure I can recommend it because it&rsquo
column3: s just too complex for the age range that it&rsquo
column4: s intended for, and too simple for kids as they get older. I suppose only time will tell if my son still enjoys this set (or any Juniors sets) in a few years, but I&rsquo
column5: m hoping in another year when his sister makes the jump to Legos&nbsp
column6: that he will be willing to build this for her. It will give the two of them a lot to play with.&nbsp
